citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC)
citeinfo.title: Advection on Larval Pollock Recruitment

descript.abstract:
This model investigates the environmental relationship between surface advection during the post-spawning period (pollock egg and larval stages) and pollock survival. OSCURS surface advection model is used to simulate drift. The model uses surface advection over a 90-day period to determine the "goodness" of the advective field for juvenile pollock. The model outputs index of pollock recruitment.
[ Reference: PICES Scientific Report No. 18 2001, Proceedings of the PICES/CoML/IPRC Workshop on "Impact of Climate Variability on Observation and Prediction of Ecosystem and Biodiversity Changes in the North Pacific", http://www.pices.int/publications/scientific_reports/Report18/default.aspx. ]
descript.purpose: To study the influence of advection on larval pollock recruitment.
